title: World Leaders Mull a Potential Second Term for Trump
content: Some governments are taking concrete steps to prepare for the possible return of the former U.S. president.
summary: Some governments are taking concrete steps to prepare for the possible return of the former U.S. president.

title: As Many South Koreans Shun Marriage, Two Women Try to Redefine Family
content: Hwang Sunwoo and Kim Hana, who are single and live together, say South Korea’s laws should reflect the alternative unions that many of its people have chosen.
summary: Hwang Sunwoo and Kim Hana, who are single and live together, say South Korea’s laws should reflect the alternative unions that many of its people have chosen.

title: France Parliament Re-elects Yaël Braun-Pivet for National Assembly President
content: A left-wing bloc that won the most seats in legislative elections this month called the re-election of Yaël Braun-Pivet, an ally of President Emmanuel Macron, a denial of democracy.
summary: A left-wing bloc that won the most seats in legislative elections this month called the re-election of Yaël Braun-Pivet, an ally of President Emmanuel Macron, a denial of democracy.

title: Evan Gershkovich, Wall Street Journal Reporter, Returns to Court in Russia
content: Mr. Gershkovich, a reporter for The Wall Street Journal, appeared at a hearing in his espionage trial. The United States and The Journal have strongly rejected the charge against him.
summary: Mr. Gershkovich, a reporter for The Wall Street Journal, appeared at a hearing in his espionage trial. The United States and The Journal have strongly rejected the charge against him.

title: In Argentina, Milei’s Devotion to Judaism Influences His Politics
content: Javier Milei has developed a public devotion to Judaism unusual for a leader of a predominantly Roman Catholic country.
summary: Javier Milei has developed a public devotion to Judaism unusual for a leader of a predominantly Roman Catholic country.

title: Germany Promised to Step Up Militarily. Its Budget Says Differently.
content: After Russia’s invasion of Ukraine, Chancellor Olaf Scholz vowed a revolution in defense strategy. But the math is not adding up.
summary: After Russia’s invasion of Ukraine, Chancellor Olaf Scholz vowed a revolution in defense strategy. But the math is not adding up.

title: Same-Sex Couples in South Korea Win Landmark Rights Ruling
content: The country’s Supreme Court said same-sex couples qualify for dependent coverage under the national health insurance, a decision that could have wider ramifications.
summary: The country’s Supreme Court said same-sex couples qualify for dependent coverage under the national health insurance, a decision that could have wider ramifications.

title: Why Is Venezuela’s President, Nicolás Maduro, on the Ballot 13 Times?
content: President Nicolás Maduro will appear over and over again on Venezuela’s presidential ballot. That is by design, government critics say.
summary: President Nicolás Maduro will appear over and over again on Venezuela’s presidential ballot. That is by design, government critics say.

title: If Maduro Wins, Venezuelans Vow to Leave
content: As many as one-third of Venezuelans would consider migrating if the country’s authoritarian leader is given another six years in power in an election set for July 28, one poll showed.
summary: As many as one-third of Venezuelans would consider migrating if the country’s authoritarian leader is given another six years in power in an election set for July 28, one poll showed.

title: Ukraine Loses Hard-Won Position Near Dnipro River in the South
content: Soldiers and military analysts said an operation to establish a foothold on the river’s Russian-controlled eastern bank was bloody and hard to justify.
summary: Soldiers and military analysts said an operation to establish a foothold on the river’s Russian-controlled eastern bank was bloody and hard to justify.

title: U.K. Failed in Handling of Covid Pandemic, Inquiry Report Says
content: The British authorities prepared for the wrong pandemic, with an outdated plan overly focused on influenza, an official investigation reported.
summary: The British authorities prepared for the wrong pandemic, with an outdated plan overly focused on influenza, an official investigation reported.

title: Marine Tondelier, the ‘Other Marine’ of French Politics, Hits Back
content: Marine Tondelier, leader of the Green Party, helped bring the left together to win France’s parliamentary elections. Now can she help keep it from falling apart?
summary: Marine Tondelier, leader of the Green Party, helped bring the left together to win France’s parliamentary elections. Now can she help keep it from falling apart?

title: Student Protests in Bangladesh Turn Deadly: What to Know
content: Seventeen people have been killed in violent clashes between the police and students protesting a quota system used to fill coveted civil service jobs.
summary: Seventeen people have been killed in violent clashes between the police and students protesting a quota system used to fill coveted civil service jobs.
